parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To will, wish, desire, be willing, intend, design.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
From basileus; properly, royalty, i.e. rule, or a realm.
One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.
This; he, she, it.
Two. A primary numeral; 'two'.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Another form for kathezomai; to seat down, i.e. Set; intransitively, to sit; figuratively, to settle.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
On the right hand, right hand, right. From dechomai; the right side or hand.
And, even, also, namely.
One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
From eu and onoma; properly, well-named, i.e. The left; neuter as adverbial, at the left hand.
